one of the things that front-end load balancer will do is so it's really more of a proxy than it is just just a load
balancer when it receives an HTTP request it's gonna send it to one of
your virtual machines that's running your code and when your virtual machine sends a response it by default is going
to add another HTTP header into the response that is the application request routing cookie so it's just some unique
identifier so that when that person that client returns to your app service with
their browser the front-end load balancer will look at that cookie and say oh you were running on instance
number two so I'm gonna make sure and take this request and send it back to the exact same instance and that's very
useful when you are writing stateful applications that are doing something like in-memory session right you want
users coming back to the exact same Ram exact same virtual machine but these
days most of us are stateless unfortunately the application and request routing / affinity cookie is
always on by default so you probably just want to set it off because that'll give you that will give you an app service it's a little more resilient you
know if one of those if you have three two instances running and one of those goes down because it fails or one of
them has to be taken offline because it needs some security update or some patch
if you're not trying to route back to the same instance you can just failover real easy to the other instance and the
application looks like it's still up and running no matter what happens another performance tip I would have is to keep
the app service always on you know how iaf just by default that's this thing where your application is idle for 20
minutes so just spin it down spin down the worker process which is nice because
that means you might be able to pack more services into the same machine and
have them running but it's not so good if you have a customer that comes back
after something is idle and is waiting for that thing to spin out after their first request unit
so if you want to avoid cold starts just go in and set always on to on and you'll
